description: This course is directed at the need to increase nursing majors knowledge and clinical expertice in the care of persons with HIV/AIDS. Hands on clinical practice with nurses who are AIDS experts will be combined with seminars that provide epidemiologic, clinical assessment, infection control, symptom management, patient teaching, psychosocial, ethical, cultural, political, and policy information.
name: CASE STUDY:  NURSING PRACTICE AND HIV+ PATIENTS

section.name: CASE STUDY:  NURSING PRACTICE AND HIV+ PATIENTS

values.comments: Students were pleased with the course, finding the instructor to be effective and interesting. Some even claimed that it was their “favorite course” at Penn and would “recommend it to anyone.” However, some students found material to be repetitive.

values.name: CASE STUDY:  NURSING PRACTICE AND HIV+ PATIENTS
